DOC.brief_summary: Phase 4 , open-label , two-year , prospective , multi-center , follow-up study conduct 15 site USA . Approximately 1,000 patient moderate-to-severe CKD enrol follow 24 month .
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Evaluation Incidence NSF Patients With Kidney Disease Undergoing MR
DOC.detailed_description: Phase 4 , open-label , two-year , prospective , multi-center , follow-up study conduct 15 active site United States . All patient receive 1 dose Ablavar part MRI examination routine clinical management . Prior undergo Ablavar MRI , patient baseline serum creatinine test within 24 hour prior Ablavar administration , sign Informed Consent ( IC ) form , undergo limited exam skin abnormality , undergo brief medical history assessment day prior Ablavar administration . A standardized NSF questionnaire administer patient 48 ( + -12 ) hour , 1 month ( + - 1 week ) , 3 month ( + - 2 week ) , 6 ( + - 1 ) month , 18 ( + - 1 ) month post-dose . At 12 ( + - 1 ) month , 24 ( + - 1 ) month . Patients return clinic limited examination skin abnormality formal review sign symptom suggestive NSF .
DOC.criteria: Kidney Disease GFR < 60 mL/min./1.73 m^2 . Clinical Need Receive MRI Contrast . Understand & Sign Informed Consent . History know suspect NSF . Has receive gadolinium base contrast agent within 12 month prior enrollment . Has clinically significant skin disorder may interfere detection cutaneous NSF manifestation . Has medical condition circumstance would significantly decrease chance obtain reliable data achieve study objective . Is unable unwilling return necessary office visit follow call , and/or examine physician undergo deep skin biopsy development NSF suspect .
DOC.keyword: NSF , Ablavar , Kidney Disease , Magnetic Resonance Imaging ( MRI ) ,
